definitions: to imply that success is guaranteed simply by being present
to suggest that no significant effort or skill is required beyond attendance
to indicate a situation is so heavily favored that participation is the only requirement for victory
examples: The opponent is so weak, he just needs to show up to win.
With his talent, someone just needs to show up to get the job.
lemma: someone just need to show up
synonyms: half the battle is showing up
source: someone just needs to show up
